channel.title: Redstone Circuit Help?
channel.description:
T = Redstone Torch B = Block Bw = Wire on top of block L = Lever
Alright, I've got this: [table] [tr] [td]BL[/td] [/tr] [tr] [td]B[/td] [/tr] [tr] [td]BT[/td] [/tr] [tr] [td]B[/td] [td]Bw[/td] [td]Bw[/td] [td]Bw[/td] [/tr] [/table]
How can I make it so that when I flick the lever, the wire that is Two blocks below is lit up?

item.title: Redstone Circuit Help?
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“ranger squad, post:1, topic:380308”]T = Redstone Torch
B = Block
Bw = Wire on top of block
L = Lever

Alright, I’ve got this:
[table]
[tr]
[td]BL[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]B[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]BT[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]B[/td]
[td]Bw[/td]
[td]Bw[/td]
[td]Bw[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

How can I make it so that when I flick the lever, the wire that is Two blocks below is lit up?[/quote]
Are you trying to use a repeater?

Don’t forget about input and output…
If it is like so:

BL
BW
BW
BT

Then the redstone torch won’t turn off, but if it is

BL
BW
w
BT

Then it will turn off. You can check a lot of redstone videos on youtube that can explain it a lot better than I can.

Read full topic

item.title: Redstone Circuit Help?
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

ranger squad:

Nope, that still doesn’t work

Then you’re doing it wrong.

You can also do it like this

BL
B
Bw Bw Bw
